title: Tsunami warning after earthquake struck off eastern Philippines
description: State agency says it caused a 'minor sea-level disturbance' and warned waves of less than a metre higher than normal.

title: Suspect in café attack that killed Russian blogger is jailed
description: Russia describes bombing as 'an act of terrorism' and blamed Ukrainian intelligence agencies for orchestrating it.

title: What does the future hold for Julian Assange?
description: WikiLeaks founder, in prison in London, is appealing extradition to the US.

title: Donald Trump faces 34 criminal charges in historic indictment
description: Trump, the first former US president to be criminally prosecuted, pleads not guilty in New York arraignment hearing.

title: Sorry for getting old
description: Ageing is a natural process, but capitalism would have you believe that it is not.

title: How many elections would it take to end the crisis in Bulgaria?
description: After holding a fifth national vote in two years, Bulgaria is nowhere near having a stable government.

title: Amir Khan, UK’s ex-world champion boxer, handed two-year ban
description: The former light-welterweight world champion returned a positive result for anabolic agent ostarine.

title: Before Trump, which other world leaders were charged or jailed?
description: It is a US first, but Donald Trump joins a list of other world leaders in facing criminal charges.

title: Al Jazeera’s Malika Bilal wins Gracie Award for best podcast host
description: Multiple-award-winning journalist garners second win in three years for excellence in work produced by and for women.

title: India rejects China’s attempt to rename places in disputed areas
description: China renames 11 places in the disputed border region as it claims sovereignty over Arunachal Pradesh.

title: Finland joins NATO as Russia’s war rages on in Ukraine
description: The Nordic nation becomes the 31st member of the world's largest military alliance as Sweden waits to join.

title: Rights groups urge UN not to adopt IHRA anti-Semitism definition
description: A letter to UN secretary-general says the definition is often used to wrongly label criticism of Israel as anti-Semitic.

title: Donald Trump’s arraignment: How the day will unfold
description: Republican to be booked, fingerprinted and arraigned as part of the first criminal case against a former US president.

title: Kenya opposition protests pause for talks: All you need to know
description: Two weeks of protests against the high cost of living and alleged electoral rigging have been paused for dialogue.

title: Banking as an American Muslim? It’s a horror
description: Closed accounts, denied transactions and investigations - Muslims face banking bias like no other faith group in the US.

title: What New Yorkers think about Trump’s arraignment in the city
description: Al Jazeera speaks to New Yorkers as the former US president returns to his hometown to appear in court.

title: Tunisia’s President Saied reappears after health rumours
description: Opposition had raised concerns that Saied was ill after the president didn't appear for almost two weeks.

title: Six killed, dozens trapped in avalanche in India’s Sikkim state
description: At least six people killed, 30 injured, and dozens missing in major avalanche near Himalayan resort in northeast India.

title: Kenya to launch first operational satellite next week
description: As of 2022, at least 13 African countries had manufactured 48 satellites, but none has been launched from African soil.

title: Venezuela opposition envoy urges Biden to ease oil sanctions
description: Fernando Blasi's call reflects a sharp break from the opposition's maximum pressure campaign of the past four years.

title: Taliban carries out deadly raid on ISIL hideout in Afghanistan
description: A police spokesman says an ISIL hideout in Nahri Shahi district was targeted and six fighters were killed.

title: Pakistan top court says provincial polls delay ‘unconstitutional’
description: Supreme Court orders the government to hold snap polls in the most populous province of Punjab on May 14.

title: Four dead in drug-related shooting on Mexico beach in Cancun
description: Mexico is plagued by cartel-related bloodshed that has seen more than 300,000 people killed since 2006.

title: The woman making waves in Turkey’s camel wrestling arenas
description: Habibe Yüksel and her dromedaries, Efecan and Mega, are taking in camel wrestling and beauty pageants by storm.

title: Are storms getting more powerful and dangerous?
description: From Malawi to Mississippi, deadly cyclones are ravaging the planet. But scientists warn they could get even scarier.

title: Sudan’s Nile fishermen worry as climate change means fewer fish
description: Climate change and overfishing threaten the livelihoods of fishermen as fish stocks dwindle and some species disappear.

title: Iraqi refugee women in Jordan sew up a storm, and a future
description: Iraqi refugee women in Jordan are making and selling clothes through a project started by Italian priests and designers.

title: US military kills top ISIL leader in raid on Syria: CENTCOM
description: US Central Command says Khalid Aydd Ahmed al-Jabouri was responsible for planning ISIL attacks in Europe.

title: What’s happening with Twitter blue checks?
description: Saturday's deadline to pay for blue checkmarks has passed and the blue ticks are still there, with a new disclaimer.

title: Asia set for strong growth after China’s opening, ADB says
description: Manila-based development bank estimates region will grow by 4.8 percent in 2023 and 2024, up from 4.2 percent last year.

title: Waterborne diseases surge among Vanuatu children after cyclones
description: Hospitals were already dealing with a rise in acute gastroenteritis when Judy and Kevin hit and cut water supplies.

title: Major fire at popular clothing market in Bangladesh capital
description: No casualties reported immediately, says official, adding that firefighters from 47 units were working to douse blaze.

title: Why central banks face a delicate balance in inflation fight
description: Central banks are seen treading carefully following the sudden collapses of Silicon Valley Bank and Credit Suisse.

title: New York City braces for historic Trump court appearance
description: US Mayor Eric Adams tells protesters to 'control yourselves' in the lead-up to Donald Trump's criminal court appearance.

title: Several injured, fire reported after Netherlands train crash
description: Two passenger carriages derailed after the train ran into construction equipment on the track early on Tuesday.

title: JPMorgan may face expanded lawsuit over Epstein ties
description: US Virgin Islands said Epstein's behaviour was 'so widely known' at the bank that executives joked about it.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 405
description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 405th day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: Australia to ban TikTok on government devices, following US, UK
description: Canberra's announcement is the latest move to restrict the popular video-sharing app over alleged security risks.

title: One in six people worldwide affected by infertility: WHO
description: UN health agency calls for cheaper and more accessible treatments to help those trying to start a family.

title: Carmaker Tesla ordered to pay $3.2m in US racial bias lawsuit
description: The multimillion-dollar award is significantly less than previously awarded in the case, brought by a former employee.
